original: Ågren, Olof Casimir, konstnär, Mis-terhult, f. 26/11/74 i Alsen, Jämtl. 1., av fanj. Nils Å. o. Christina Winn-berg. G. 33 m. Elisaibeth Bergström. — Stud. v. konstakad. i Sthlm 98-03, i Berlin o. Paris 08-10, Ital. o. Syd-frankr. 20-27. Tillh. konstn :gruppen Optimisterna, utf. naivistiska stadsmotiv, ’hamnbilder, dekorativa komp. m. m., som inbj. delt. i Carnegiestift. utst. i Pittsburgh 36-37, repr. i bl. a. Nat:-mus., Thüelska gall, Gbgs, Västerås, Östersunds o. Norrköp. mus. Numera lantbr. i Flivik.
translated: Ågren, Olof Casimir, artist, Mis-terhult, b. 26/11/74 in Alsen, Jämtland, son of sergeant Nils Å. and Christina Winnberg. Married in 1933 to Elisaibeth Bergström. — Studied at the Royal Swedish Academy of Fine Arts in Stockholm from 1898 to 1903, in Berlin and Paris from 1908 to 1910, and in Italy and southern France from 1920 to 1927. Belonged to the art group Optimisterna, produced naïve cityscapes, harbor scenes, decorative compositions, and more, which were exhibited in the Carnegie Art Galleries in Pittsburgh from 1936 to 1937, and represented in institutions such as the National Museum, Thüelska Gallery in Gothenburg, Västerås, Östersund, and Norrköping museums. Currently engaged in farming in Flivik.

education.institution: Royal Swedish Academy of Fine Arts
